remarks.format: ## Remarks 這個方法覆寫 。This method overrides . 當您呼叫也會排清方法時，作業系統 I/O 緩衝區。When you call the method, the operating system I/O buffer is also flushed. 除非您明確地呼叫無法排清資料流編碼器或處置物件。A stream’s encoder is not flushed unless you explicitly call or dispose of the object. 設定至`true`表示從緩衝區資料流，清除資料，但並不會清除編碼器狀態。Setting to `true` means that data will be flushed from the buffer to the stream, but the encoder state will not be flushed. 這可讓編碼器將保存其狀態 （部分字元），讓它可以正確編碼字元的下一個區塊。This allows the encoder to keep its state (partial characters) so that it can encode the next block of characters correctly. 這種情況下會影響 UTF8 及 UTF7 其中某些字元可以只編碼的編碼器接收或多個相鄰的字元之後。This scenario affects UTF8 and UTF7 where certain characters can only be encoded after the encoder receives the adjacent character or characters. 因為緩衝區可供讀取或寫入，執行下列兩個功能：Because a buffer can be used for either reading or writing, performs the following two functions: - 任何之前寫入緩衝區的資料複製到檔案，除了其編碼器狀態清除緩衝區。Any data previously written to the buffer is copied to the file and the buffer is cleared except for its encoder state. - 如果是`true`資料先前已從檔案複製到讀取的緩衝區，檔案中目前的位置也會減少在緩衝區中讀取的位元組數目。If is `true` and data was previously copied from the file to the buffer for reading, the current position within the file is decremented by the number of unread bytes in the buffer. 然後會清除緩衝區。The buffer is then cleared. 使用方法多載，當您想要確保所有中繼檔案緩衝區中緩衝資料寫入至磁碟。Use the method overload when you want to ensure that all buffered data in intermediate file buffers is written to disk. ## Examples 這個程式碼範例是針對所提供之較大範例的一部分方法。This code example is part of a larger example provided for the method.
